result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Baker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Phillip Baker.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defense not ready to proceed at the scheduled time.  Court proceeded with the remainder of the calendar.  Court rescheduled hearing. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Phillip Baker not in court, in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Phillip Baker in court by video with Attorney Fred Richardson who appears in person.  Defendant Phillip Baker in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Matte.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Proposed No Contact Order.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Solly's Bar & Grill and Closet Classics.

Defendant Phillip Baker in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Phillip Baker in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
